reviewText: This is one of the best compilation CDs, along with new material that has come out in years.  All George's best tunes with the new ones are excellent.  Whether or not you are a George Michael fan, you have to admit that every once in a while - when one of these old songs comes on the radio, you are singing along with it!  Great job!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have not seen all of these videos before. I had one of the previous greatest hits video collection, and I thought that one was pretty good (even though now it's a bit dated, and so much has happened since then) But this one looks great, sounds great, and has everything I wanted it to have (and more I didn't even know existed). The Hightlight for me was the video for "AS" a remake of a Stevie Wonder classic. I am not a huge Mary J. Blige fan, but they work great together. and the video/song were awesome. I had never seen this before or heard the song before. I now have the Twenty Five 3disc collection, and I'd recommend that as well. Both are great. You may have noticed I have been saying great a lot lol, well George Michael is a very talented singer/songwriter/performer. Such a soulful voice, and very creative visually as well. Kissing a Fool has always been one of my favorites. Not sure why it wasn't included on the corresponding cd though. I liked the nostalgic theme of the old smoky cafe. I didn't like that song when I first heard it but it grew on me and is now one of my all time favorites. Great video.I would highly recommend this set for anyone. Not just George Michael fans but for anyone who loves great music. If you are a casual fan watching this will make you want to buy the corresponding albums (at least his solo work). My only qualm with this set,well two things, one I hate the case it comes in, as it arrived with a cut on the spine, as if someone cut the shrink wrap off of it. but it was sealed. But I hate dvds that do not come in a hard case. Everyone screams how enviromentally friendly these types of cases are, but they are cheap cardboard that gets messed up. I never intend to throw out my dvds. If I have something that either becomes obsolete or is replaced with something better then I give my dvds to someone who wants it. I never throw away cds or dvds. In fact I am more likely to throw away cases like this when they get messed up. With hard cases you just buy a new case. But generally they last a long time. Just me commenting on how music/movie companies rip off the true collectors, no wonder people download illegally, when what they purchase isn't any better than what they downloaded. My second thing is I would have loved a booklet of some kind, either describing the videos or why they were made. Kind of a behind the scenes thing. But neither of these things kept me from enjoying the videos, so that is why it still gets 5 stars (a rarity from me). You won't go wrong by purchasing this.
summary: Great Collection of Videos by one of the Best in the Business
Title: N/A

reviewText: Most of George Michael's hits are in this video compilation and the video and audio quality are near perfect, which is good considering how old many of these videos are, especially from his days with Wham. If you are a fan, buy this video collection and you won't be disappointed. Rated PG, for some semi-risque scenes. Nothing too offensive to adults or teenagers.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Watching these videos you are able to understand all over again the infectous nature of George Michaels Music.  Great hooks, great beats and clever visuals make all of these videos fun.  Even the older WHAM videos, with all that 80s blowdried feathered hair, have their redeeming features.  It is sad that he had so many record company and personal problems later in life because watching these videos you can see his talent never waned.  Highly recommended.  These are great to put on at a party. Gets everyone talking about the good old days (1980s!)
